metadata.title: CVE-2017-6362 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Double free vulnerability in the gdImagePngPtr function in libgd2 before2.2.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via vectorsrelated to a palette with no colors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6362` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.8
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.8').
